text: Welcome to this PSTET demo lesson on child development basics.
In this chapter, we connect classroom observation with practical pedagogy.
A teacher should read behavior patterns before selecting any intervention strategy.
Development is continuous, but children still progress through recognizable stages.
Assessment should guide learning support, not only ranking and comparison.
Use formative checks often, so you can identify gaps early and adapt teaching.
Language-rich environments improve confidence, retention, and student participation.
Inclusive classrooms require differentiated examples for mixed learning levels.
At the end of this lesson, complete the linked mock assessment to unlock progress.
Keep revising with notes and repeated practice to improve your PSTET score.
